intro: Galium coloradoense, commonly known as Colorado bedstraw, is a low-growing perennial herb native to the western United States. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny white or pinkish flowers in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and stream banks. Its delicate appearance and ecological role in supporting pollinators make it an important species in its native habitat.
